meanings.definition: To cut or slash (a knitted garment) in order to create an opening or shape.
meanings.sent1: She was carefully steeking the sweater to make room for the buttons.
meanings.sent2: The knitter decided to steek the cardigan to add pockets.
meanings.sent3: After steeking the scarf, it looked like a whole new design!
meanings.sent4: Steeking through the fabric of tradition, she created a modern masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The sound of steeking through the yarn was oddly satisfying.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting or slashing a knitted garment.
meanings.sent1: The steeking of the sweater was a bold move by the designer.
meanings.sent2: She carefully sewed the edges of the steeking to prevent fraying.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected steeking mishap left everyone in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The steeking on the dress revealed a pop of color underneath.
meanings.sent5: The intricate steeking on the hat showcased the knitter's skill.
